sense.name: Cause to be perplexed or mentally confounded.
sense.examples: The third problem really stumped her. I'm stumped! The new riddle stumps me.

sense.name: Travel through an area, (as if) by walking heavily.
sense.commentary: Includes: STUMP ALONG Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] STUMP NP2[location] NP1[agent] STUMP (PP{P NP[location]})
sense.examples: He stumped along the highroad that lead to Madrid. The men stumped through the snow looking for their lost friend. The candidate stumped the Northeast in search of support.

sense.name: Remove tree stumps from an area.
sense.examples: Stump that field before the day's done. I paid the men to stump my yard.
